TABLE: audit_logs
MODEL: AuditLog
MODULE: Models.Admin.AuditLog

DESCRIPTION:
The base class of the class hierarchy. When called, it accepts no arguments and returns a new featureless instance that has no instance attributes and cannot be given any.

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - user_id: INTEGER [FK -> users.id, NOT NULL]
  - action: VARCHAR(100) [NOT NULL]
  - resource_type: VARCHAR(50) [NOT NULL]
  - resource_id: VARCHAR(200)
  - resource_name: VARCHAR(500)
  - details: TEXT
  - ip_address: VARCHAR(45)
  - user_agent: VARCHAR(500)
  - timestamp: DATETIME [NOT NULL]

TABLE: audit_logs

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: audit_logs.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: audit_logs.user_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Foreign Key: References users.id

COLUMN: audit_logs.action
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: audit_logs.resource_type
  Type: VARCHAR(50)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: audit_logs.resource_id
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.resource_name
  Type: VARCHAR(500)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.details
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.ip_address
  Type: VARCHAR(45)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.user_agent
  Type: VARCHAR(500)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.timestamp
  Type: DATETIME
  Nullable: False
  Default: <function datetime.utcnow at 0x000001E629524900>

TABLE: audit_logs
MODEL: AuditLog

RELATIONSHIP: user
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: User

JOIN CONDITION:
AuditLog.user_id == User.id

BACK POPULATES: audit_logs
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM audit_logs
JOIN users ON AuditLog.user_id == User.id

TABLE: audit_logs
MODEL: AuditLog
MODULE: Models.Admin.User

DESCRIPTION:
The base class of the class hierarchy. When called, it accepts no arguments and returns a new featureless instance that has no instance attributes and cannot be given any.

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - user_id: INTEGER [FK -> users.id, NOT NULL]
  - action: VARCHAR(100) [NOT NULL]
  - resource_type: VARCHAR(50) [NOT NULL]
  - resource_id: VARCHAR(200)
  - resource_name: VARCHAR(500)
  - details: TEXT
  - ip_address: VARCHAR(45)
  - user_agent: VARCHAR(500)
  - timestamp: DATETIME [NOT NULL]

TABLE: audit_logs

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: audit_logs.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: audit_logs.user_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Foreign Key: References users.id

COLUMN: audit_logs.action
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: audit_logs.resource_type
  Type: VARCHAR(50)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: audit_logs.resource_id
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.resource_name
  Type: VARCHAR(500)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.details
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.ip_address
  Type: VARCHAR(45)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.user_agent
  Type: VARCHAR(500)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: audit_logs.timestamp
  Type: DATETIME
  Nullable: False
  Default: <function datetime.utcnow at 0x000001E629524900>

TABLE: audit_logs
MODEL: AuditLog

RELATIONSHIP: user
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: User

JOIN CONDITION:
AuditLog.user_id == User.id

BACK POPULATES: audit_logs
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM audit_logs
JOIN users ON AuditLog.user_id == User.id

TABLE: roles
MODEL: Role
MODULE: Models.Admin.User

DESCRIPTION:
Role Model - Defines user roles and permissions. This model stores role definitions that determine what actions users can perform within the system. Attributes: id (int): Primary key, auto-incrementing name (str): Unique role name (e.g., 'admin', 'user', 'viewer') Max length: 100 characters Relationships: users: One-to-many relationship with User model A role can be assigned to multiple users Common Roles: - admin: Full system access and administration - user: Standard user with project access - viewer: Read-only access to assigned projects Usage Example: admin_role = Role(name="admin") user_role = Role(name="user")

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - name: VARCHAR(100) [UNIQUE]

TABLE: roles

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: roles.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Primary key, auto-incrementing

COLUMN: roles.name
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: True
  Unique: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Unique role name (e.g., 'admin', 'user', 'viewer')

TABLE: roles
MODEL: Role

RELATIONSHIP: users
TYPE: one-to-many
TARGET MODEL: User

JOIN CONDITION:
Role.id == User.role_id

BACK POPULATES: role
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM roles
JOIN users ON Role.id == User.role_id

TABLE: users
MODEL: User
MODULE: Models.Admin.User

DESCRIPTION:
User Model - Represents system users with authentication and authorization. This model stores user account information, authentication credentials, and links to roles for permission management. Attributes: id (int): Primary key, auto-incrementing username (str): Unique username for login Max length: 100 characters email (str): Unique email address Max length: 100 characters hashed_password (str): Bcrypt hashed password (never store plain text) registered_at (datetime): Account creation timestamp role_id (int): Foreign key linking to Role model Relationships: role: Many-to-one relationship with Role model Each user has exactly one role audit_logs: One-to-many relationship with AuditLog model Tracks user actions for audit purposes Security Features: - Passwords are stored as bcrypt hashes - Unique constraints on username and email - Role-based access control - Audit trail for user actions Usage Example: user = User( username="john_doe", email="john@company.com", hashed_password=bcrypt_hash, role_id=user_role.id )

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - username: VARCHAR(100) [UNIQUE]
  - email: VARCHAR(100) [UNIQUE]
  - hashed_password: VARCHAR
  - registered_at: DATETIME
  - role_id: INTEGER [FK -> roles.id]

TABLE: users

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: users.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Primary key, auto-incrementing

COLUMN: users.username
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: True
  Unique: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Unique username for login

COLUMN: users.email
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: True
  Unique: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Unique email address

COLUMN: users.hashed_password
  Type: VARCHAR
  Nullable: True
  Description: Bcrypt hashed password (never store plain text)

COLUMN: users.registered_at
  Type: DATETIME
  Nullable: True
  Default: 2025-11-07 01:25:44.430917
  Description: Account creation timestamp

COLUMN: users.role_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True
  Foreign Key: References roles.id
  Description: Foreign key linking to Role model

TABLE: users
MODEL: User

RELATIONSHIP: role
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: Role

JOIN CONDITION:
User.role_id == Role.id

BACK POPULATES: users
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM users
JOIN roles ON User.role_id == Role.id

TABLE: users
MODEL: User

RELATIONSHIP: audit_logs
TYPE: one-to-many
TARGET MODEL: AuditLog

JOIN CONDITION:
User.id == AuditLog.user_id

BACK POPULATES: user
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM users
JOIN auditlogs ON User.id == AuditLog.user_id

TABLE: user_project_access
MODEL: UserProjectAccess
MODULE: Models.Admin.User

DESCRIPTION:
User Project Access Model - Manages project-specific user permissions. This model provides fine-grained access control by defining which projects a user can access and what level of permissions they have for each project. Attributes: id (int): Primary key, auto-incrementing user_id (int): Foreign key to User model project_id (str): Foreign key to BOQ projects table (optional) permission_level (str): Level of access (view, edit, admin) Default: "view" Ranproject_id (str): Foreign key to RAN projects table (optional) Ropproject_id (str): Foreign key to ROP projects table (optional) Permission Levels: - view: Read-only access to project data - edit: Can modify project data - admin: Full control over project (edit, delete, manage users) Project Types: - BOQ Projects: Standard Bill of Quantities projects - RAN Projects: Radio Access Network projects - ROP Projects: Resource Optimization Planning projects Business Logic: - A user can have access to multiple projects - Different permission levels for different projects - Supports all three project types in the system - Nullable project IDs allow for flexible access patterns Usage Example: access = UserProjectAccess( user_id=user.id, project_id="PRJ001_PO123", permission_level="edit" )

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - user_id: INTEGER [FK -> users.id, NOT NULL]
  - project_id: VARCHAR(200) [FK -> projects.pid_po]
  - Ranproject_id: VARCHAR(200) [FK -> ran_projects.pid_po]
  - Ropproject_id: VARCHAR(200) [FK -> rop_projects.pid_po]
  - permission_level: VARCHAR(50) [NOT NULL]

TABLE: user_project_access

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: user_project_access.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Primary key, auto-incrementing

COLUMN: user_project_access.user_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Foreign Key: References users.id
  Description: Foreign key to User model

COLUMN: user_project_access.project_id
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: True
  Foreign Key: References projects.pid_po
  Description: Foreign key to BOQ projects table (optional)

COLUMN: user_project_access.Ranproject_id
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: True
  Foreign Key: References ran_projects.pid_po
  Description: Foreign key to RAN projects table (optional)

COLUMN: user_project_access.Ropproject_id
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: True
  Foreign Key: References rop_projects.pid_po
  Description: Foreign key to ROP projects table (optional)

COLUMN: user_project_access.permission_level
  Type: VARCHAR(50)
  Nullable: False
  Default: view
  Description: Level of access (view, edit, admin)

TABLE: ai_actions
MODEL: AIAction
MODULE: Models.AI.Document

DESCRIPTION:
Audit log for AI-performed actions Tracks what the AI did for compliance and debugging

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - user_id: INTEGER [FK -> users.id, NOT NULL]
  - conversation_id: VARCHAR(100) [NOT NULL]
  - action_type: VARCHAR(100) [NOT NULL]
  - action_params: JSON [NOT NULL]
  - action_result: JSON
  - status: VARCHAR(20)
  - error_message: TEXT
  - timestamp: DATETIME
  - execution_time_ms: INTEGER

TABLE: ai_actions

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: ai_actions.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: ai_actions.user_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Foreign Key: References users.id

COLUMN: ai_actions.conversation_id
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: ai_actions.action_type
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: ai_actions.action_params
  Type: JSON
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: ai_actions.action_result
  Type: JSON
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: ai_actions.status
  Type: VARCHAR(20)
  Nullable: True
  Default: success

COLUMN: ai_actions.error_message
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: ai_actions.timestamp
  Type: DATETIME
  Nullable: True
  Indexed: Yes
  Default: <function datetime.utcnow at 0x000001E629586160>

COLUMN: ai_actions.execution_time_ms
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True

TABLE: ai_actions
MODEL: AIAction

RELATIONSHIP: user
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: User

JOIN CONDITION:
AIAction.user_id == User.id

BACK POPULATES: None
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM ai_actions
JOIN users ON AIAction.user_id == User.id

TABLE: chat_history
MODEL: ChatHistory
MODULE: Models.AI.Document

DESCRIPTION:
Stores conversation history for context-aware AI responses

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - user_id: INTEGER [FK -> users.id, NOT NULL]
  - conversation_id: VARCHAR(100) [NOT NULL]
  - role: VARCHAR(20) [NOT NULL]
  - content: TEXT [NOT NULL]
  - project_type: VARCHAR(20)
  - project_id: INTEGER
  - timestamp: DATETIME
  - tokens_used: INTEGER
  - function_calls: JSON

TABLE: chat_history

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: chat_history.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: chat_history.user_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Foreign Key: References users.id

COLUMN: chat_history.conversation_id
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: False
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: chat_history.role
  Type: VARCHAR(20)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: chat_history.content
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: chat_history.project_type
  Type: VARCHAR(20)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: chat_history.project_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: chat_history.timestamp
  Type: DATETIME
  Nullable: True
  Indexed: Yes
  Default: <function datetime.utcnow at 0x000001E629584CC0>

COLUMN: chat_history.tokens_used
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True
  Default: 0

COLUMN: chat_history.function_calls
  Type: JSON
  Nullable: True
  Default: <function list at 0x000001E629584D60>

TABLE: chat_history
MODEL: ChatHistory

RELATIONSHIP: user
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: User

JOIN CONDITION:
ChatHistory.user_id == User.id

BACK POPULATES: None
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM chat_history
JOIN users ON ChatHistory.user_id == User.id

TABLE: documents
MODEL: Document
MODULE: Models.AI.Document

DESCRIPTION:
Stores metadata for uploaded documents (PDFs, DOCX, etc.) Linked to projects for context-aware retrieval

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - project_type: VARCHAR(20)
  - project_id: INTEGER
  - filename: VARCHAR(255) [NOT NULL]
  - file_path: VARCHAR(500) [NOT NULL]
  - file_type: VARCHAR(50) [NOT NULL]
  - file_size: INTEGER
  - upload_date: DATETIME
  - uploaded_by: INTEGER [FK -> users.id]
  - tags: JSON
  - summary: TEXT
  - document_type: VARCHAR(100)
  - extracted_entities: JSON
  - processing_status: VARCHAR(20)
  - processing_error: TEXT

TABLE: documents

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: documents.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: documents.project_type
  Type: VARCHAR(20)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: documents.project_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: documents.filename
  Type: VARCHAR(255)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: documents.file_path
  Type: VARCHAR(500)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: documents.file_type
  Type: VARCHAR(50)
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: documents.file_size
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: documents.upload_date
  Type: DATETIME
  Nullable: True
  Default: <function datetime.utcnow at 0x000001E62955E2A0>

COLUMN: documents.uploaded_by
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True
  Foreign Key: References users.id

COLUMN: documents.tags
  Type: JSON
  Nullable: True
  Default: <function list at 0x000001E62955E480>

COLUMN: documents.summary
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: documents.document_type
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: documents.extracted_entities
  Type: JSON
  Nullable: True
  Default: <function dict at 0x000001E62955E520>

COLUMN: documents.processing_status
  Type: VARCHAR(20)
  Nullable: True
  Default: pending

COLUMN: documents.processing_error
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: True

TABLE: documents
MODEL: Document

RELATIONSHIP: chunks
TYPE: one-to-many
TARGET MODEL: DocumentChunk

JOIN CONDITION:
Document.id == DocumentChunk.document_id

BACK POPULATES: document
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('delete,delete-orphan,expunge,merge,refresh-expire,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM documents
JOIN documentchunks ON Document.id == DocumentChunk.document_id

TABLE: documents
MODEL: Document

RELATIONSHIP: uploader
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: User

JOIN CONDITION:
Document.uploaded_by == User.id

BACK POPULATES: None
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM documents
JOIN users ON Document.uploaded_by == User.id

TABLE: document_chunks
MODEL: DocumentChunk
MODULE: Models.AI.Document

DESCRIPTION:
Text chunks from documents for vector search Each chunk is embedded and stored in Qdrant

COLUMNS:
  - id: INTEGER [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - document_id: INTEGER [FK -> documents.id, NOT NULL]
  - chunk_text: TEXT [NOT NULL]
  - chunk_index: INTEGER [NOT NULL]
  - vector_id: VARCHAR(100) [UNIQUE, NOT NULL]
  - page_number: INTEGER
  - section_title: VARCHAR(255)
  - chunk_metadata: JSON

TABLE: document_chunks

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: document_chunks.id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes

COLUMN: document_chunks.document_id
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False
  Foreign Key: References documents.id

COLUMN: document_chunks.chunk_text
  Type: TEXT
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: document_chunks.chunk_index
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: False

COLUMN: document_chunks.vector_id
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: False
  Unique: Yes

COLUMN: document_chunks.page_number
  Type: INTEGER
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: document_chunks.section_title
  Type: VARCHAR(255)
  Nullable: True

COLUMN: document_chunks.chunk_metadata
  Type: JSON
  Nullable: True
  Default: <function dict at 0x000001E62955FC40>

TABLE: document_chunks
MODEL: DocumentChunk

RELATIONSHIP: document
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: Document

JOIN CONDITION:
DocumentChunk.document_id == Document.id

BACK POPULATES: chunks
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM document_chunks
JOIN documents ON DocumentChunk.document_id == Document.id

TABLE: items_for_lvl3
MODEL: ItemsForLvl3
MODULE: Models.BOQ.Levels

DESCRIPTION:
The base class of the class hierarchy. When called, it accepts no arguments and returns a new featureless instance that has no instance attributes and cannot be given any.

COLUMNS:

TABLE: projects
MODEL: Project
MODULE: Models.BOQ.Project

DESCRIPTION:
Project Model - Represents a telecommunications infrastructure project. This model stores basic project information including project identifiers, purchase order details, and project names. It serves as the primary reference for organizing all BOQ-related data within the system. Attributes: pid_po (str): Primary key - Combined Project ID and Purchase Order identifier Format: Usually combines PID and PO with a separator Max length: 200 characters Example: "PRJ001_PO123" pid (str): Project ID - Unique identifier for the project Max length: 100 characters Example: "PRJ001" po (str): Purchase Order number - Financial tracking identifier Max length: 100 characters Example: "PO123" project_name (str): Human-readable project name/description Max length: 200 characters Example: "Metro Network Expansion Phase 1" Indexes: - Primary key index on pid_po - Index on pid for fast project lookups - Index on po for purchase order tracking - Index on project_name for search functionality Relationships: This model is referenced by various other models including: - Inventory items - BOQ levels and structures - LLD (Low Level Design) items - Dismantling records Usage Example: project = Project( pid_po="PRJ001_PO123", pid="PRJ001", po="PO123", project_name="Metro Network Expansion Phase 1" )

COLUMNS:
  - pid_po: VARCHAR(200) [PRIMARY KEY, NOT NULL]
  - pid: VARCHAR(100)
  - po: VARCHAR(100)
  - project_name: VARCHAR(200)

TABLE: projects

COLUMN DETAILS:

COLUMN: projects.pid_po
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: False
  Primary Key: Yes
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Primary key - Combined Project ID and Purchase Order identifier

COLUMN: projects.pid
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: True
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Primary key - Combined Project ID and Purchase Order identifier

COLUMN: projects.po
  Type: VARCHAR(100)
  Nullable: True
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Primary key - Combined Project ID and Purchase Order identifier

COLUMN: projects.project_name
  Type: VARCHAR(200)
  Nullable: True
  Indexed: Yes
  Description: Human-readable project name/description

TABLE: items_for_ranlvl3
MODEL: ItemsForRANLvl3

RELATIONSHIP: ranlvl3
TYPE: many-to-one
TARGET MODEL: RANLvl3

JOIN CONDITION:
ItemsForRANLvl3.ranlvl3_id == RANLvl3.id

BACK POPULATES: items
CASCADE: CascadeOptions('merge,save-update')

USAGE EXAMPLE:
SELECT * FROM items_for_ranlvl3
JOIN ranlvl3s ON ItemsForRANLvl3.ranlvl3_id == RANLvl3.id

TABLE: items_for_ranlvl3
ENUM: TypeofService

ALLOWED VALUES:
Software, Hardware, Service

BUSINESS RULE:
The TypeofService field can only contain one of these values: Software, Hardware, Service

EXAMPLE SQL:
WHERE typeofservice IN ('Software', 'Hardware', 'Service')
